content: वरम् {%<ab>ind.</ab>%} Rather or better than, preferably to, it is better that &c. It is sometimes used with the ablative; समुन्नयन् भूतिमनार्यसंगमाद्वरं विरोधोपि समं महात्मभिः <ls>Ki. 1. 8.</ls> But it is generally used absolutely, वरं being used with the clause containing the thing preferred, and न च, न तु, or न पुनः with the clause containing the thing to which the first is preferred, (both being put in the nominative case); वरं मौनं कार्यं न च वचनमुक्तं यदनृतं… वरं भिक्षाशित्वं न च परधनास्वादनसुखं <ls>H. 1</ls>; वरं प्राणत्यागो न पुनरधमानामुपगमः {%<ab>ibid.</ab>%}; sometimes न is used without च, तु or पुनः; याच्ञा मोघा वरमधिगुणे नाधमे लब्धकामा <ls>Me. 6.</ls>
